wikipedia_page.main: John Charles Burkill  (1 February 1900,  Holt, Norfolk, England – 6 April 1993,  Sheffield, England) was an English mathematician who worked on analysis and introduced the Burkill integral. He was elected a fellow of the Royal Society in 1953. In 1948, Burkill won the Adams Prize.  He was Master of Peterhouse until 1973. His doctoral students include Frederick Gehring.
